intro: Oenothera anisoloba, commonly known as the narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. Oenothera anisoloba is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses and related species. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
